references.formattedCitation: Lancaster, Jerrad, University of London, and Royal Holloway. “Syracusan Settlement Expansion in South-Eastern Sicily in the Archaic Period.” Ph.D. Dissertation, Royal Holloway, 2017. https://pure.royalholloway.ac.uk/portal/en/publications/syracusan-settlement-expansion-in-southeastern-sicily-in-the-archaic-period(d3c36979-6d18-48ac-9b4b-c29587f92732).html.

Thucydides. Thucydidis Historiae; recognovit brevique adnotatione critica instruxit Henricus Stuart Jones .. Edited by Henry Stuart Jones and J. Enoch Powell. 2 vols. Oxonii: e typographeo Clarendoniano, 1942. http://data.perseus.org/texts/urn:cts:greekLit:tlg0003.tlg001.perseus-grc1.

description: An important ancient city on the island of Sicily.
details:
Syracusae was founded on the southeast coast of Sicily as a colony of Corinth in 734/3 B.C. Initially concentrated on the coastal island Ortygia, the settlement moved to the mainland and developed into an important and powerful urban center. Syracusae would, in turn, establish secondary colonies: Akrai (664 B.C.), Kasmenai (624 B.C.), and Kamarina (559 B.C.).

The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Siracusa/Syracuse
